title: Album Page, "Well Head, Venice", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on textured thick white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 103; clockwise from bottom right edge: 1943-51-170; Venice; (on ruled line): Plan 1/2 scale / Well head 1/20 execution.
dimensions: 14.4 x 16 cm (5 11/16 x 6 5/16 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.9 cm (12 9/16 x 9 13/16 in.), irregular
description: Sheet cut down to make a rectangle slightly larger in width than height.  Depicted is a stone, carved well head with Christian iconography.  The well is in the shape of a capital.  It is raised on a small square plinth with canted corners.  The main sculptural composition consists of two figures kneeling, their arms resting on one bent knee to support a cross inscribed within two circles, like a Greek cross. There is a small diamond-pattern molding above.  The well appears to have a two-sided cover that hinges in the middle and, when opened, the cover rests against an ironwork scroll.  A chain hangs over the edge of the well on the right.  At the bottom left is the well head in plan view.  A scale is indicated for each sketch.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Well Head, Venice", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Graphite on textured thick white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-170.
